title: Gallery Talk: Weaving beyond the Bauhaus
hero_caption: Designed by Sheila Hicks, Produced by V'SOSKE. Rug, about 1965.Gift of Sheila Hicks.
short_description: Weaving beyond the Bauhaus marks the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Bauhaus art school in Germany. Join exhibition curator Erica Warren to explore the profound impact of the school's weaving workshop, especially on American artists such as Sheila Hicks, Ethel Stein, and Claire Zeisler.
description:
Weaving beyond the Bauhaus marks the 100th anniversary of the founding of the Bauhaus art school in Germany. Join exhibition curator Erica Warren to explore the profound impact of the school's weaving workshop, especially on American artists such as Sheila Hicks, Ethel Stein, and Claire Zeisler.

Please note that the image on this page is for reference purposes only and may not be featured during the gallery talk.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
buy_button_caption: Free with museum admission, no registration required
